poem:
Title: "On the Vestiges of Commerce"

A sterling tapestry unfolds
of fiber and consequences unmet.
Superdry, once bustling with fickle fashion,
now contains echoes and woeful half-smiles.
Tales of loss found in tailor's threads,
the retail waltz now stationary.
Yet, there is renewal in this quiet,
in unclicked hangers and whispered goodbyes,
a testament not to cease, but pause.
The reincarnation of style, always in vogue.
